etymology.description: Depicts a hat -> original form of 帽(帽) (mào, "hat"), in which it appears as ⺜
etymology.interpretation: 冃(mào, "hat") is a pictogram representing the basic shape of a hat and is the original form of 帽(帽) (mào, "hat"), with the additional semantic element of 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") representing the material typically used to make hats.

examples.chinese: 他戴着红色的冃(他戴著紅色的冃)，抵御寒冷(抵禦寒冷)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dài zhe hóng sè de mào, dǐ yù hán lěng.
examples.english: He wears a red hat to resist the cold.

examples.chinese: 别忘了拿冃(別忘了拿冃)，出门时戴好(出門時戴好)。
examples.pinyin: Bié wàng le ná mào, chū mén shí dài hǎo.
examples.english: Don't forget to take your hat and wear it when you go out.
